Posts.EditableText:
Yah, anyways,

I'm a pure vegetarian.  No dairy, no meat, no msg, and as less as man-made chemicals as possible.  Mmmm, pure 100% fruit juice, and teas are good too.  Seeds, such as sunflower and pumpkin, are good when mixed with carob chips and dehydrated raisins and cranberries.  Ever eat a can of pumpkin mixed with potatoes and blackberries or blueberries or both... add some bananas too!  Honey on bread is better than peanut butter; less blockage; less time on the toilet.  Why anyone would brag about being fat is beyond me... I guess it's just one of those I'm-destructive-to-myself behaviors, or should I write "behaviours," that keeps this forum progressing towards... hmmm, what is this forum progressing to?

Well, anyways, 
I'll hand over the up-and-coming section below to a poster that most likely will be either negating everything I just wrote or negating something someone else has written above or negating themself or... whatever.

-W. Wyzwurd

Posts.EditableText:
Oooh!  It seems nobody is at this machine... I'll just slip my token tied to a string in the slot here... pull it back out... and, wahlah, free space!  What should I write about?  Hmmm...

I LIKE FOODS WITH CHEMICALS THAT ONE FINDS IN WINDOW CLEANER, SO WHEN I SWEAT IT SITS ON THE SURFACE OF MY SKIN AND FORMS ZITS THE COLOR OF MY *BLEEP*.  YAH, COOL, I SWORE.  I LIKE TO DRINK HIGH CAFFEINE ENERGY DRINKS, BECAUSE I'M SO DEPRESSED, AND THE MEDS I'M ON, WELL, HONESTLY, THEY DON'T COME IN A HIGHLY ATTRACTIVE COLORFUL CAN.  DAMN! MY BUZZ IS UP.  ANYONE ELSE IN HERE FAT? FAT PEOPLE ROCK! I HAVE MORE FAT THAN YOU; EVEN THESE LETTERS ARE FAT; I MEAN F-F-F-FAAAT-T-T!  HERE'S A COOKIE.  GET FAT WITH ME.  FAST FOOD... AWWW YAH! FAST FOOD: GOTTA LOVE IT.  HOT, GREASY, MSG FILLED FOOD SURE TO MAKE YOUR SPLEEN CRY HELP, AND THE CHANCE TO BE AUTISTIC; ONE COULDN'T ASK FOR ANYTHING MORE.  FRY?  JUST KIDNEYING.  I MEAN KIDDING.  ACTUALLY, DON'T HAVE ANY KIDNEYS.  NAWP!  HAD TO REMOVE WHAT WAS LEFT OF THEM.  ROTTED FROM THE METHYL-ACTOBENZOATTIUM-DIBROPATHIUMANOIA-TRYGLICERATE.  AND BY THE WAY... SORRY, NO FRIES LEFT.  I'M SO FAT THAT I THOUGHT FAT32 PARTITIONING WAS ON THE MENU.  DOG-GONE!  DOG?  DID I SAY DOG?  I DID SAY DOG! DOG... SOUNDS TASTY... MMMM!  GONNA GET ME SOME DOG.

-75/75

Posts.EditableText: Funny as a Whopper is from Burger King which is a British Company As a side story, when I went to London with my dad, we took the train from Gatwick to Victoria station. When we got off the train, I told him I was hungry so he said when we left the station he would get me some English food. And when we left the station, the first place we saw was a Burger King and he said there you go. So I had an English Wopper at the nearest Burger King to the Queen's Palace
Posts.HTML:
Funny as a Whopper is from Burger King which is a British Company

As a side story, when I went to London with my dad, we took the train from Gatwick to Victoria station. When we got off the train, I told him I was hungry so he said when we left the station he would get me some English food.

And when we left the station, the first place we saw was a Burger King and he said there you go.

So I had an English Wopper at the nearest Burger King to the Queen's Palace

Posts.EditableText:
I don't often like eating out... I like semi-real restaurantes (like harvester/beefeater/etc), real restaurantes, and my own cooking.
If push comes to shove, I can pick out a couple of things to have in a sub or some KFC (popcorn chicken stuff)..

Much prefer my own cooking/food though.

Posts.EditableText: We quit eating out at fast food resteraunts about a year and a half ago...and though I would have never admited this when I was younger, I feel a lot better than I did through most of my twenties. We go out to a nice establishment every once and a while, but with two kids that ends up being expensive. The first two months that Ree and I quit eating fast food 2 meals a day we saved something like $1500 bucks. I could not believe it. I tell my friends how much more cash they would have if they would cut back on the McDonalds, but they don't listen to me...oh well. For the record, back when I ate out alot....Burger King and the Whopper. HELL YEAH. Subway kicked butt too.
